Devices Card#

async baecon.GUI.cards.devices_card.add_chosen_device(device_category: str, device_name_holder: Holder, device_type_holder: Holder, device_load_last: Holder, gui_fields: GUI_fields, meas_settings: Measurement_Settings)#

Adds device using the desired configuration.

By default, the last_config for the device is loaded. If no such file exists, the default config file is load. And if no such file exists again, the class default configurations are used.

Alternatively, you can choose to select a configuration file to load.

Parameters:

  • device_category (str) – Scan_Devices or Acquisition_Devices.

  • device_name_holder (gui_utils.Holder) – Holder for chosen name.

  • device_type_holder (gui_utils.Holder) – Holder for type of device, e.g. SG380 or NIDAQ_Base.

  • device_load_last (gui_utils.Holder) – Boolean; True indicates load last_config and False indicates to launch the file picker dialog.

  • gui_fields (gui_utils.GUI_fields) – All fields for the GUI.

  • meas_settings (bc.Measurement_Settings) – Settings that completely describe the measurement.

async baecon.GUI.cards.devices_card.add_device_button(device_category: str, gui_fields: GUI_fields, meas_settings: Measurement_Settings)#

Async function for calling the add_device_dialog window.

Parameters:

  • device_category (str) – Scan_Devices or Acquisition_Devices.

  • gui_fields (gui_utils.GUI_fields) – All fields for the GUI.

  • meas_settings (bc.Measurement_Settings) – Settings that completely describe the measurement.

async baecon.GUI.cards.devices_card.add_device_dialog(device_category: str, gui_fields: GUI_fields, meas_settings: Measurement_Settings)#

Makes a ui.dialog for choosing a device to add.

The list of devices is populated from the :py:obj:`bc.DEVICES_DIRECTORY. When adding a device you choose the working name, a.k.a. nickname, for the device to have in the experiment, which is different than the device class (a.k.a type).

The device will not be loaded without a working name.

Parameters:

  • device_category (str) – Scan_Devices or Acquisition_Devices.

  • gui_fields (gui_utils.GUI_fields) – All fields for the GUI.

  • meas_settings (bc.Measurement_Settings) – Settings that completely describe the measurement.

baecon.GUI.cards.devices_card.add_remove_button_labels(devices_catagory_holder: Holder) → tuple#

Chooses the button labels for either Scan Devices or Acquisition Device.

Parameters:

devices_catagory_holder (gui_utils.holder) – Holder object for which device catagory the card is.

Returns:

The labels for the buttons for add_device_button and

remove_device_button.

Return type:

tuple

_List of Device modules available.

async baecon.GUI.cards.devices_card.choose_device(grid: AgGrid, dialog: Dialog, device_category: str, device_name_holder: Holder, device_type_holder: Holder, device_gui_enabled: Holder, device_load_last: Holder, gui_fields: GUI_fields, meas_settings: Measurement_Settings)#

Loads chosen Device.

On clicking the Choose Device, the device is loaded with

Parameters:

  • grid (ui.aggrid) – Table showing available device types.

  • dialog (ui.dialog) – Pop-up dialog holding for choosing a device.

  • device_category (str) – Scan_Devices or Acquisition_Devices.

  • device_name_holder (gui_utils.Holder) – Holder for chosen name.

  • device_type_holder (gui_utils.Holder) – Holder for type of device, e.g. SG380 or NIDAQ_Base.

  • device_gui_enabled (gui_utils.Holder) – Boolean indicating to open device specific gui.

  • device_load_last (gui_utils.Holder) – Boolean; True indicates load last_config and False indicates to launch the file picker dialog.

  • gui_fields (gui_utils.GUI_fields) – All fields for the GUI.

  • meas_settings (bc.Measurement_Settings) – Settings that completely describe the measurement.

baecon.GUI.cards.devices_card.determine_device(gui_event: EventArguments, devices_catagory: str, gui_fields: GUI_fields, meas_settings: Measurement_Settings) → tuple[baecon.device.device.Device, dict, dict]#

Determines device from the GUI event arguments and device catagory.

The property sender of gui_event is used a the start element for the gui_utils.find_gui_element().

This method then returns the Device of the device, a dict of device names and currently used config file, and acquisition_devices or `scan_devices property of bc.Measurement_Settings.

Parameters:

  • button_event (events.ClickEventArguments) – Event args from clicking save button.

  • device_category (str) – Scan_Devices or Acquisition_Devices.

  • gui_fields (gui_utils.GUI_fields) – All fields for the GUI.

  • meas_settings (bc.Measurement_Settings) – Settings that completely describe the measurement.

Returns:

Tuple where the first element is a : py:class:Device <baecon.device.Device> and the second a dictitonary

with elements {device_name: config file name}, and either acquisition_devices or `scan_devices.

Return type:

tuple[bc.Device, dict, dict]

baecon.GUI.cards.devices_card.device_buttons(device_name: str, category: str, meas_settings: Measurement_Settings)#

Buttons within the device drop-down expansion.

These allow for opening the device specific GUI, reconnecting to the device, and toggling device output on and off.

Parameters:

  • device_name (str) – Chosen working name.

  • device_category (str) – Scan_Devices or Acquisition_Devices.

  • meas_settings (bc.Measurement_Settings) – Settings that completely describe the measurement.

baecon.GUI.cards.devices_card.device_column_holder = Holder(value='')#

todo: Devices currenlty can only apear in the cards. Adding custom pages for devices would be good, so for things like pulse generators can display the pulse pattern, or for cameras show an image for aligning etc.

Returns:

baecon.GUI.cards.devices_card.device_load_config(file: str, device_name_holder: Holder, device_type_holder: Holder) → dict#

Loads device configuration from the file provided and returns it in a dictionary.

If None is given as the file, then this method will look for the default configuration file. If that file isn’t found, this method return a dictionary of the class defaults.

Parameters:

  • file (str) – String of file path.

  • device_name_holder (gui_utils.Holder) – Holder for chosen name.

  • device_type_holder (gui_utils.Holder) – Holder for type of device, e.g. SG380 or NIDAQ_Base.

Returns:

Configruation dictionary for the device.

Return type:

dict

baecon.GUI.cards.devices_card.device_output(value: int, device_name: str, meas_settings: Measurement_Settings)#

Turns the device on or off.

Parameters:

  • value (int) – On or off values (1 or 0).

  • device_name (str) – Device being controlled.

  • meas_settings (bc.Measurement_Settings) – Settings that completely describe the measurement.

baecon.GUI.cards.devices_card.device_tabs(device_name: str, device_configuration: dict, device_category: str, gui_fields: GUI_fields, meas_settings: Measurement_Settings)#

Generates the tabs in the drop-down expansion of the device.

The tabs are given by any dictionary term given in the configuration dictinary. For all device this includes parameters and latent_parameters. Some devices will have extra entries in configuration dictionary, which will also be given a tab.

Each device also gets a tab for saving and loading its configuration to a configuration file.

Parameters:

  • device_name (str) – Chosen working name.

  • device_configuration (dict) – Configuration dictionary for the device.

  • device_category (str) – Scan_Devices or Acquisition_Devices.

  • gui_fields (gui_utils.GUI_fields) – All fields for the GUI.

  • meas_settings (bc.Measurement_Settings) – Settings that completely describe the measurement.

baecon.GUI.cards.devices_card.generate_device_list(device_name_holder: Holder)#

Generates the list of devices available to load in baecon.

Reads baecon.DEVICES_DIRECTORY and populates the aggrid.

Parameters:

device_name_holder (gui_utils.Holder) – Holder for working name of device.

Returns:

The aggrid listing the available devices.

Return type:

aggrid

baecon.GUI.cards.devices_card.get_device_config(device_load_last: Holder, device_name_holder: Holder, device_type_holder: Holder) → dict#

Finds path to the last_config file and loads its configuration

If last_file is not found in the device’s directory, None is passed to device_load_config().

Parameters:

  • device_load_last (gui_utils.Holder) – Boolean; True indicates load last_config and False indicates to launch the file picker dialog.

  • device_name_holder (gui_utils.Holder) – Holder for chosen name.

  • device_type_holder (gui_utils.Holder) – Holder for type of device, e.g. SG380 or NIDAQ_Base.

Returns:

Configruation dictionary for the device.

Return type:

dict

baecon.GUI.cards.devices_card.list_parameters(device_name: str, parameters: dict, meas_settings: Measurement_Settings)#
Generates a tab and lists the supplied parameters for a device. Here

parameters includes the devices parameters, latent_parameters, and other parameter dicts specific to the device.

Parameters:

  • device_name (str) – Working name of device for which the tab is being made.

  • parameters (dict) – Dictionary of parameters for which to create input fields.

  • meas_settings (bc.Measurement_Settings) – Settings that completely describe the measurement.

async baecon.GUI.cards.devices_card.load_button(button_event: ClickEventArguments, device_catory: str, gui_fields: GUI_fields, meas_settings: Measurement_Settings) → None#

Opens a dialog with to pick and load a device configuration file.

The name of the device is taken from the click arguments of the button object.

Parameters:

  • button_event (events.ClickEventArguments) – Event args from clicking save button.

  • device_category (str) – Scan_Devices or Acquisition_Devices.

  • gui_fields (gui_utils.GUI_fields) – All fields for the GUI.

  • meas_settings (bc.Measurement_Settings) – Settings that completely describe the measurement.

baecon.GUI.cards.devices_card.main(gui_fields: GUI_fields, meas_settings: Measurement_Settings, devices_catagory: str)#
Main function for the Devices GUI card.

Both scan_devices and acquisition_devices use this card.

Flow:

  • Device card is constructed and populated based on gui_config and devices_catagory.

  • On pressing add or remove device buttons, the devices_catagory_holder will be updated based on the button text, and the device will be added to gui_config.

  • After device is added/removed, the list of devices is updated by devices_catagory_holder as the key for the correct card in devices_card_holder.

functools.partial can be used to provide args to async functions.

Parameters:

  • gui_config (gui_utils.GUI_Measurement_Configuration) – The dictionary of Measurement_Settings determined from the GUI fields. At time of measurement, this is passed to baecon.

  • meas_settings (bc.Measurement_Settings) – Object defining the entire measurement.

  • devices_catagory (str) – “Scan Devices” or “Acquisition Devices” to make the respective cards.

baecon.GUI.cards.devices_card.open_device_gui(device_category: str, device_name_holder: Holder, meas_settings: Measurement_Settings) → None#

Opens device specific GUI in a seperate browser tab.

Device specific GUI should be kept in the corresponding Device directory.

Parameters:

  • device_category (str) – Scan_Devices or Acquisition_Devices.

  • device_name_holder (gui_utils.Holder) – Holder for chosen name.

  • meas_settings (bc.Measurement_Settings) – Settings that completely describe the measurement.

Opens dialog window to pick file to save the device as.

async baecon.GUI.cards.devices_card.save_as_last_config(button_element: ClickEventArguments, devices_catagory: str, gui_fields: GUI_fields, meas_settings: Measurement_Settings) → None#

Save current device configuration in last_config file.

This method is called when the GUI is shutdown. Shutdown events don’t send event arguments, so the save button element is used to create dummy ClickEventArguments.

Parameters:

  • button_event (events.ClickEventArguments) – Event args from clicking save button.

  • device_category (str) – Scan_Devices or Acquisition_Devices.

  • gui_fields (gui_utils.GUI_fields) – All fields for the GUI.

  • meas_settings (bc.Measurement_Settings) – Settings that completely describe the measurement.

async baecon.GUI.cards.devices_card.save_button(button_event: ClickEventArguments, device_category: str, gui_fields: GUI_fields, meas_settings: Measurement_Settings) → None#

Saves current device configuration.

The configuration is saved to the file currently specified in the GUI. The name of the device is taken from the click arguments of the button object.

Parameters:

  • button_event (events.ClickEventArguments) – Event args from clicking save button.

  • device_category (str) – Scan_Devices or Acquisition_Devices.

  • gui_fields (gui_utils.GUI_fields) – All fields for the GUI.

  • meas_settings (bc.Measurement_Settings) – Settings that completely describe the measurement.

baecon.GUI.cards.devices_card.save_load_tab(device_category: str, device_name: str, gui_fields: GUI_fields, meas_settings: Measurement_Settings)#

Populates the device tab with saving and loading GUI elements.

These elements are buttons for load, save, and save as, as well as an input box for the file name.

save_as_last_config() is specified in this function, since there is already saving happening. Upon the app disconnecting (equivalent to shutting down), the current configuration of the device will be save in the last_config file.

Parameters:

  • device_category (str) – Scan_Devices or Acquisition_Devices.

  • device_name (str) – Chosen working name.

  • gui_fields (gui_utils.GUI_fields) – All fields for the GUI.

  • meas_settings (bc.Measurement_Settings) – Settings that completely describe the measurement.

baecon.GUI.cards.devices_card.show_devices(device_category: str, gui_fields: GUI_fields, meas_settings: Measurement_Settings)#

Populates the device card with the measurement devices.

These are the devices listed in meas_settings.

Parameters:

  • device_category (str) – Scan_Devices or Acquisition_Devices.

  • gui_fields (gui_utils.GUI_fields) – All fields for the GUI.

  • meas_settings (bc.Measurement_Settings) – Settings that completely describe the measurement.

  • parameter (str) – Parameter to set to new value.
